problems.text: Alex walks 1 km on day 1, 1.5 km on day 2, 2 km on day 3, and so on. How far does he walk on day 8?
problems.hint: This is an arithmetic sequence. Each day he walks 0.5 km more than the previous day.

problems.text: A classroom has 4 chairs in the first row, 7 in the second, continuing in this pattern. How many in 6 rows?
problems.hint: This is the sum of an arithmetic sequence. Each row has 3 more chairs than the previous row.
steps: Use the sum formula: S_n = n/2 × (2a + (n - 1)d)

problems.text: A student scores 70 on the first test and increases the score by 5 in each following test. What is the score on the 5th test?
problems.hint: This is an arithmetic sequence. Each test score increases by 5.

problems.text: A delivery truck drops off 10 bottles, then 12 the next day, 14 the next. How many bottles after 8 days?
problems.hint: This is the sum of an arithmetic sequence. Each day the number of bottles increases by 2.
steps: Use the sum formula: S_n = n/2 × (2a + (n - 1)d)
